titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ralph Bates Papers
titlestmt.author: by Karen Spicher

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 8, 2019 at 04:00

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

langmaterial.language: Chiefly in English, with some materials in Arabic.

did.abstract: The Papers contain correspondence with literary colleagues and family, most 1960s-1990s; drafts and reviews of novels and short stories, 1960s-2000; writings of others about Bates, most 1980s-1990s; audiocassettes of lectures by Bates about literature, 1960s-1970s, and interviews with him about his life and writings, 1980s; personal papers, including biographical information and legal documents, 1930s-1970s; a few photographs and documents concerning his International Brigade service during the Spanish Civil War; and materials relating to Jonathan Bates's imprisonment in Syria, 1972-1974, including correspondence with American and Syrian officials, legal documents, notes, and clippings.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Ralph Bates Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ralph Bates Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from William Reese Co. on the George Henry Nettleton Fund, 2003.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 13-14 (audiocassettes): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

bioghist.head: Ralph Bates (1899-2000)
bioghist.p: English author; wrote novels about Spain; served with Republican forces in the Spanish Civil War; professor of creative writing and English literature at New York University, 1947-1966; later lived in Naxos, Greece. Bates was married to Eve Salzman; their son Jonathan Bates was imprisoned in Syria on charges of espionage, 1972-1974.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Correspondence, 1960s-1990s. II. Writings, 1964-2000. III. Writings of Others, 1943-1996. IV. Personal Papers, 1930-2002. V. Papers Relating to Jonathan Bates's Imprisonment in Syria, 1972-1974.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: Uncat Mss 431. In 2013, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. Most folder titles were based on information provided by the vendor, while some were assigned by Library staff. Folder titles were not verified against contents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Papers contain correspondence with literary colleagues and family, most 1960s-1990s; drafts and reviews of novels and short stories, 1960s-2000; writings of others about Bates, most 1980s-1990s; audiocassettes of lectures by Bates about literature, 1960s-1970s, and interviews with him about his life and writings, 1980s; personal papers, including biographical information and legal documents, 1930s-1970s; a few photographs and documents concerning his International Brigade service during the Spanish Civil War; and materials relating to Jonathan Bates's imprisonment in Syria, 1972-1974, including correspondence with American and Syrian officials, legal documents, notes, and clippings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by correspondent name, followed by unsorted correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains incoming correspondence, with some outgoing drafts and carbons, and some third-party correspondence of Eve Salzman. Some letters are accompanied by writings of others.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also additional correspondence in the Writing series and the Papers Relating to Jonathan Bates's Imprisonment in Syria series.

did.physloc: See also: Papers Relating to Jonathan Bates's Imprisonment

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes letter from Bates to Klaus about Stephen Spender

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings listed by title include drafts and reviews of novels; drafts and printed clippings of short stories and poems; and an audio recording of a short story draft. Some unpublished writings are listed under working titles. Other writings include unidentified short stories and unsorted review of novels.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title, followed by lectures, arranged chronologically; other writings, arranged by genre; and unsorted writings.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 13 and 14 contain audiovisual material (audiocassettes). Restricted fragile. Reference copies are available upon request. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes biographical information and obituaries; audiocassettes of interviews with Bates; identification documents; and an International Brigade discharge document and photographs relating to his service in the Spanish Civil War.
